warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Perform squats without weights, focusing on form and depth. Complete 2 sets of 10 reps.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand next to a wall for support.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Swing one leg forward and backward, then side to side. Complete 1 set of 10 swings per leg.
Rotate hips in a circular motion, first clockwise, then counterclockwise. Complete 1 set of 10 circles each direction.

exercises.setup: Position the barbell on your upper traps. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
execution: 1. Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Unrack the barbell and step back, keeping your feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Engage your core and keep your chest up.
4. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight.
5. Descend until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
6. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Start with a weight that allows for proper form and control, typically around 50-60% of your one-repetition maximum (1RM).
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Hold a kettlebell or dumbbell close to your chest with both hands.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the weight close to your chest with both hands.
3. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight.
4. Descend until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
5. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a kettlebell or dumbbell that allows for proper form, typically around 20-30% of your body weight.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a stable core and avoid letting your knees cave inward during the squat.

exercises.setup: Use a barbell, similar to a conventional deadlift setup.
execution: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell with an overhand grip.
2. Keep your legs straight but not locked, and hinge at the hips.
3. Lower the barbell down your legs, keeping it close to your body.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to return to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Start with a light weight to focus on form, typically around 40-50% of your one-repetition maximum (1RM).
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Hold a barbell or dumbbells in front of your thighs.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell or dumbbells.
2. Keep your knees slightly bent and hinge at the hips.
3. Lower the weights down your legs, keeping them close to your body.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to return to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a weight that allows for proper form, typically around 30-40% of your one-repetition maximum (1RM).
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders during the movement.

exercises.setup: Use a leg press machine with a medium stance width.
execution: 1. Sit on the leg press machine and place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform.
2. Release the safety handles and lower the platform by bending your knees.
3. Descend until your thighs are parallel to the platform.
4. Push through your heels to extend your legs and return to the starting position.
5. Maintain a slight bend in your knees at the top.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows for a full range of motion, typically around 60-70% of your one-repetition maximum (1RM).
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Position yourself on the hack squat machine with your shoulders under the pads.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart on the platform.
2. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips.
3. Descend until your thighs are parallel to the platform.
4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a weight that allows for proper form, typically around 50-60% of your one-repetition maximum (1RM).
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a controlled movement and avoid locking your knees at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Use a Glute Ham Raise machine or set up on a lat pull-down machine with a counterbalance.
execution: 1. Position your feet under the footplate and your knees on the pad.
2. Lower your body by bending at the knees, keeping your back straight.
3. Engage your hamstrings to pull your body back to the starting position.
4. Avoid using momentum and focus on a controlled movement.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Bodyweight or light resistance if needed.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Secure your feet under a stable surface or use a Nordic Hamstring Curl Bench.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Kneel on a padded surface with your feet secured.
2. Lower your body forward by extending your knees.
3. Engage your hamstrings to pull your body back to the starting position.
4. Focus on controlling the movement and avoid using momentum.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Bodyweight or light resistance if needed.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on controlling the negative portion of the movement to maximize muscle engagement.

exercises.setup: Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench and a barbell over your hips.
execution: 1. Roll the barbell over your hips and position your feet flat on the ground.
2. Drive through your heels to lift your hips until they are fully extended.
3. Keep a neutral pelvis and squeeze your glutes at the top.
4. Lower your hips back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Start with a moderate weight that allows for full hip extension, typically around 50-60% of your one-repetition maximum (1RM).
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Position yourself with your upper back against a bench and one foot flat on the ground.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Place one foot flat on the ground and extend the other leg.
2. Drive through your heel to lift your hips until they are fully extended.
3. Keep a neutral pelvis and squeeze your glutes at the top.
4. Lower your hips back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on each leg.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a weight that allows for proper form, typically around 20-30% of your body weight.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a neutral pelvis and avoid arching your lower back during the movement.
